fields.Title: INVENTORY / LEDGER OF FAILURE
fields.Description:
Perform a closer inspection of the ledger found in the trash (your official paperwork). Find:
1. serial number
2. forms
3. notes on cases
4. wife's letter
5. toilet smell

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, how very childish of you," he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, how very childish of you," he mumbles. "In your -- and my -- defence, almost everyone in the RCM uses the *titular* system. In addition to the official alphanumeric."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Beaten to death by a throng of Vill..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Beaten to death by a throng of Villalobos gang-members when him and his partner J. M. (only initials mentioned) answered a call one night. It's a sad story and it isn't really represented in *your* case files. Stop stalling and get to the MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR.

fields.Title: You: "Really stupid."
fields.Dialogue Text: Really stupid.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yeah, really lame. So anyway -- you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, really lame. So anyway -- young man, in his twenties, found with his skull busted open. Right on the floor of the hookah parlour. In the middle of the day. No one else is in there. Only client that day. In perfect health too, some kind of movie producer.

fields.Title: You: "He sucked hookah, stood up, passed..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He sucked hookah, stood up, passed out, hit his head on the table and died?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "That's right. They trained you for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's right. They trained you for this in cop school. Everyone has to pick a civil specialization so they can keep the city running: fire safety, first aid training, and so on. You took *building safety regulation*. And it tells you that this one -- is coming down.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "As we speak. And you can't *keep* t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As we speak. And you can't *keep* them from going back, because they all hate you. They despise you. They think you threw them out of their homes. Every day they despise you more -- and every day, more of them go back.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "...is *STILL* NOT WHAT HAPPENS. Fuc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ...is *STILL* NOT WHAT HAPPENS. Fuck this compartment. You should throw it away.

fields.Title: You: "Nod and return to the case notes."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nod and return to the case notes.

fields.Title: Half Light: "Your kill count. Yours will surely..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your kill count. Yours will surely have your kill count.

fields.Title: You: "Browse the case files again."
fields.Dialogue Text: Browse the case files again.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You feel that thing in the back of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You feel that thing in the back of your head? That little voice, that quiet scream? You already felt this was a bad idea, but especially right now it's even worse. Try as you might, you can't read it now.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's the ledger you found in the tr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's the ledger you found in the trash: a pitiful cabbage of white and yellow papers hanging from plastic board, barely held together by a metal clip. This sad display is made complete by the faint smell of urinal cleaner.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's a metaphor -- for you."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's a metaphor -- for you.

fields.Title: You: "Browse the *white* papers."
fields.Dialogue Text: Browse the *white* papers.

fields.Title: You: "Maybe it's kitchen tissue? They loo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe it's kitchen tissue? They look exactly the same.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "The tasks you've completed flow out..."]
Half Light: "You like this grimy *murdering*, do..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You like this grimy *murdering*, don't you?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's okay." He nods, then turns..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's okay." He nods, then turns back to his own case files. "We all make mistakes."

fields.Title: Drama: "Can't you see the *sire* is tired o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Can't you see the *sire* is tired of these... fabrications. *RAC* is clearly what it says on the case files. These are official documents. There is no arguing with *official* documents.

fields.Title: Logic: "No, the alphanumeric begins with HD..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, the alphanumeric begins with HDB.

fields.Title: You: "Public indecency."
fields.Dialogue Text: Public indecency.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "No, that's Burke. Leslie's *schtick..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, that's Burke. Leslie's *schtick* is flashing his genitals, remember? How will you ever solve THE UNSOLVABLE CASE if you can't even get that straight? Well, turns out it's pretty simple. The case becomes *considerably* less comic one day, when Burke takes a swing at your ledger.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "That's because you know where this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's because you know where this leads to.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You see two ticket stubs and a hand..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You see two ticket stubs and a handmade card.
fields.Alternate1: You see two ticket stubs.

fields.Title: You: ""No.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "No."

fields.Title: You: ""Okay, let's keep it.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, let's keep it."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yes -- all that remains now is to f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes -- all that remains now is to fill those forms and *hand* them to people: fines for wrongdoers, interview requests for bad guys, and field autopsies to *dead* guys.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Mills has no idea. Invisible assass..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Mills has no idea. Invisible assassin. Movie deal gone sour. Girl at the counter did it. Nothing fits. Eerie. Man just dropped dead. So you go to the parlour. You see cushions around the table. Table's low, heavy, really sharp edge...

fields.Title: You: "In the apartment I got the call to?"
fields.Dialogue Text: In the apartment I got the call to?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The Ledger of (Oblivion Induced) Me..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The Ledger of (Oblivion Induced) Mental Health is just as shabby as the Damaged Ledger anyway. A bunch of sodden papers on a clipboard. Better not to waste more time with it.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "There's a piece of toilet paper --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's a piece of toilet paper -- or is it cleaning tissue? No, it's toilet paper -- *desperately* sticking to the back of the blue plastic clipboard.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Mhm, cool toilet paper... I mean ki..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Mhm, cool toilet paper... I mean kitchen tissue.

fields.Title: You: ""It must have been cramping my styl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It must have been cramping my style."

fields.Title: You: "Forget about it for now -- how is t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Forget about it for now -- how is the rest of this thing doing?

fields.Title: Empathy: "The lieutenant fears this will lead..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant fears this will lead to fiddling with the delicate, folding headlights on his motor carriage. They're dear to him.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "They're not *exactly* white. They'r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They're not *exactly* white. They're yellowed in patches by sunlight and alcohol, and covered in dense blue handwriting. Ink escapes into watercolour patterns, reaching its tendrils across entire pages. The paper itself is chequered with faint red lines forming short paragraphs.

fields.Title: You: ""Fine, I'll just use this crappy pe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Fine, I'll just use this crappy pencil..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. That's a good one...""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good. That's a good one..."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "U4-sized pages hang from the clip s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: U4-sized pages hang from the clip screwed to the top of the board.

fields.Title: You: "Wait... HDB41? Weren't those: 'Offi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait... HDB41? Weren't those: 'Officer, precinct'?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The mural is enormous. Two silhouet..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The mural is enormous. Two silhouettes -- a man and a woman -- are kissing. The text cut into their forms reads:

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "No one cares what you believe in, m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No one cares what you believe in, man with the smelly toilet ledger. What do you want to tackle next? Or are we done?

fields.Title: You: "Pick up the ticket stubs."
fields.Dialogue Text: Pick up the ticket stubs.

fields.Title: You: "Open it."
fields.Dialogue Text: Open it.

fields.Title: You: "But it will make me *happy*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But it will make me *happy*...

fields.Title: Shivers: "COME OUTSIDE."
fields.Dialogue Text: COME OUTSIDE.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Under Precinct 41, where typewriter..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Under Precinct 41, where typewriters fire long into the night, and officers walk the great steps and the bridge. Long after the card has landed in the cold shore waters, its writing dissolved. Material disintegrated.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. Okay." He nods. "It's a good..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay. Okay." He nods. "It's a good name, but it has *one* problem -- this case has nothing to do with the setting sun. At all. It has nothing to do with that. So..."

fields.Title: You: ""Let me guess -- the HANGED MAN?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let me guess -- the HANGED MAN?"

fields.Title: You: ""Yeah, not feeling it.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yeah, not feeling it."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Like a fan of gills the chequered p..."]
Perception (Smell): "*Exactly* like the gum wrapper you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Exactly* like the gum wrapper you found. The same brand of chewing gum...

fields.Title: You: "Keep reading."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep reading.

fields.Title: You: "He must have sucked a lot of it."
fields.Dialogue Text: He must have sucked a lot of it.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "This one's bad. Not that far from P..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This one's bad. Not that far from Precinct 41 -- in Central Jamrock -- there is an eight story apartment building with two hundred residents inside. It's the dead of winter, January. Snowing. Someone's beating their wife. It's half past midnight.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Maybe not tonight. Maybe not even t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe not tonight. Maybe not even tomorrow. Maybe not the day after, but it's coming down. In a matter of days. It is physically impossible for it not to. And the two hundred people in there? They are all going down with it. The woman with the busted lip, the husband who beats her, their kids in the other room...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The drunk in the hallway. The girl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The drunk in the hallway. The girl in the elevator when you were going up. The youths on the stairs, laughing, smoking. The couple next to the apartment -- who made the call. They're all going to die.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Your captain puts them in a half-bu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your captain puts them in a half-burned building 10 km South. It's got black mould and no roof, but hey -- it's better than death.

fields.Title: You: "They looked really cool. Like a roc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They looked really cool. Like a rock band.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's okay." He nods, then turns..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's okay." He nods, then turns back to his own case files. "We all do, sooner or later."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Usual is boring. We don't do that."
fields.Dialogue Text: Usual is boring. We don't do that.

fields.Title: Volition: "You've got *business* to deal with..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've got *business* to deal with first. Talk to the Union boss first, at least... I can't stop you for long, but there's just enough of an excuse now.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Below the pathetics -- terror. Do n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Below the pathetics -- terror. Do not look into its blue heart.

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Why yes it is! Among many other thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why yes it is! Among many other things. This cleaning tablet is used by the Whirling-in-Rags -- perhaps that's where the ledger was dropped in the toilet? By you.

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Your nose does not understand what..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your nose does not understand what it did wrong.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "What are you talking about? No one'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What are you talking about? No one's out to get you -- get real man! Upgrade that cop-ledger!

fields.Title: You: "What I should do is get back to mak..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What I should do is get back to making sense of this thing. (Discard.)

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Wordless, he pulls one from the loo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wordless, he pulls one from the loop and hands it to you. The pen is cold, blue, and ready to write.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Inspect victim's body.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Inspect victim's body."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Three. The topmost are MISCONDUCT F..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Three. The topmost are MISCONDUCT FINES, the middle ones  are STATION CALLS, and the bottommost are FIELD AUTOPSY FORMS. Each is easy enough to make sense of.

fields.Title: You: ""Kim, look, *field autopsy*.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, look, *field autopsy*."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Thin see-through copier paper -- mo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Thin see-through copier paper -- mostly neon yellow, some bright red -- all covered in boxes like marching armies. These are your official forms, easy enough to make sense of...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He smiles. "I pray his loved ones n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He smiles. "I pray his loved ones never find out."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The plastic shimmers like lapis laz..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The plastic shimmers like lapis lazuli, but it is not see-through. You cannot see to its centre...

fields.Title: You: "MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR"
fields.Dialogue Text: MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "What are you waiting for? Just..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What are you waiting for? Just...

fields.Title: Endurance: "No! No! Hold on."
fields.Dialogue Text: No! No! Hold on.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ha! Yes." He isn't actually laughi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ha! Yes." He isn't actually laughing. "I have to tell you officer, I don't appreciate *ironic* titles. Other officers will have to use this as reference. If it's 'IDIOT', or 'COCK FINGER'..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure? I think it's pretty..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Are you sure? I think it's pretty serviceable..."

fields.Title: You: "Keep reading."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep reading.

fields.Title: Empathy: "It actually. Does. You've offended..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It actually. Does. You've offended him.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yeah. So anyway -- young man, in hi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah. So anyway -- young man, in his twenties, found with his skull busted open. Right on the floor of the hookah parlour. In the middle of the day. No one else is in there. Only client that day. In perfect health too, some kind of movie producer.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Who knows? Those pages are missing...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Who knows? Those pages are missing. What next?

fields.Title: Half Light: "This toilet paper will show everyon..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This toilet paper will show everyone what a bum you are. How little you give a shit. This toilet paper will PUNISH the world.

fields.Title: You: "I'm a police man. This is police wo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm a police man. This is police work. I'm just following the leads, you know?

fields.Title: You: "(Leave it there, it's cool.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: (Leave it there, it's cool.)

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "If you *want* it to be kitchen tiss..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If you *want* it to be kitchen tissue, it can be kitchen tissue.

fields.Title: You: "Smell the ledger."
fields.Dialogue Text: Smell the ledger.

fields.Title: You: "I don't know, it seems foreboding t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't know, it seems foreboding to me somehow. Like there's something in there that's out to get me.

fields.Title: You: ""Like -- for example?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Like -- for example?"

fields.Title: Logic: "You should turn them on and get in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You should turn them on and get in front of those headlights -- see what happens. There may be information on there, a *halogen watermark* he called it.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He is not really saying anything. J..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He is not really saying anything. Just standing there -- looking at them.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Things to be done and things alread..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Things to be done and things already done -- the composition of reality. This is an extremely useful tool for a detective of the Citizens Militia.
fields.Alternate1: Things to be done and things already done -- the composition of reality. This is an extremely useful tool for a detective of the Citizens Militia. Now all that remains is to name the case.

fields.Title: You: "More?"
fields.Dialogue Text: More?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right. Of course." He returns to h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Right. Of course." He returns to his notes, leaving you to yours.

fields.Title: You: ""What happened to him?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What happened to him?"

fields.Title: You: "What did you say the colour was?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What did you say the colour was?

fields.Title: Logic: "Every last alphanumeric in the file..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Every last alphanumeric in the files begins with it -- and these are *your* case files. It's safe to say H.D.B. are your initials.

fields.Title: You: "I can revisit this. (Put the case f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I can revisit this. (Put the case files away.)

fields.Title: You: "COLLAPSING TENEMENT"
fields.Dialogue Text: COLLAPSING TENEMENT

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "In any case, it appears to have bee..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In any case, it appears to have been a rare case of civil activity in the Quarter. And agreement as well. What do you want to tackle next?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The case files do not show you find..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The case files do not show you finding the author of the design.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "*He came at us* -- *And at us* -- *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *He came at us* -- *And at us* -- *I think he was trying to kill Burke-o*. While trying to kill Burke-o, you slowly come around. The permeables' compartment is open. You've smashed it open on poor Burke'o's kneecaps. The good news is, Burke can't walk anymore.

fields.Title: Half Light: "Kill them. They broke it."
fields.Dialogue Text: Kill them. They broke it.

fields.Title: Horrific Necktie: "That doesn't sound like it's gonna..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That doesn't sound like it's gonna be *fun*.

fields.Title: Half Light: "Your hand shakes. You're flushed wi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your hand shakes. You're flushed with adrenaline.

fields.Title: You: "Put it back."
fields.Dialogue Text: Put it back.

fields.Title: Volition: "Not for yourself -- for the people..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not for yourself -- for the people of Revachol.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel the air sucked out of your lungs and the blood sucked out of your head. Everything around you gets dark. Small white dots appear...

fields.Title: You: "Hold on."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hold on.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, is everything alright?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Detective, is everything alright?"

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "This would also be a good time to f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This would also be a good time to finally *name* the case -- if only Lieutenant Kitsuragi were here so you could coordinate. No use naming it without him... maybe at a later time you can come back to this?

fields.Title: Interfacing: "The ledger only comes with an old w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The ledger only comes with an old worn-down led pencil. It will *do*, barely... but...

fields.Title: You: "Can you get high off it?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Can you get high off it?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yeah, he liked his hookah. Steven w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, he liked his hookah. Steven was his name.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
Perception (Smell): "Garbage-toilet stink is not your fe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Garbage-toilet stink is not your fetish and you know it. Your nose does *not* fucking like this.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "*Way* cool."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Way* cool.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "FACE THE DESOLATION! This is *your*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: FACE THE DESOLATION! This is *your* ledger. You're a COP and it's your official ledger. It's filled out in *your* hand and it *stinks* like you too. And looks like you.

fields.Title: You: "Shut up, nose. I don't need your he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shut up, nose. I don't need your help -- I don't need *anyone's* help!

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sad to hear that." For a momen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm sad to hear that." For a moment he doesn't know what to reply.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, no problem." He turns away t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, no problem." He turns away to start organizing his own notes -- leaving you with yours.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Somewhere -- not here -- the helpfu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Somewhere -- not here -- the helpful Lieutenant Kitsuragi is making notes in his blue notebook. He tilts it ever so slightly, a glowing rectangle catches the light. He could advise you with this. The next moment...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Interview the cafeteria manager.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Interview the cafeteria manager."

fields.Title: You: "Inspect the handwriting in the file..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Inspect the handwriting in the files.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "You're a swashbuckler with that pen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're a swashbuckler with that pen, Harry. And it feels good. Feels like *completion*.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "*Pedagogical* somehow. Brash. It mu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Pedagogical* somehow. Brash. It must be yours for you to be able to read it. These are the lines of someone who has written by hand *a lot* and has developed a style only they themselves -- or *you yourself* -- can decipher.

fields.Title: You: "How long does it take to read a cas..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How long does it take to read a case?

fields.Title: You: "All that remains is to wreak havoc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All that remains is to wreak havoc on the middle class.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "AKA LESLIE & BURKE, AKA THE PUBLIC..."
fields.Dialogue Text: AKA LESLIE & BURKE, AKA THE PUBLIC INDECENCY DRUNK & THE PROPERTY DAMAGE DRUNK is a *cursed* case. It has been passed from unsuspecting officer to unsuspecting officer for ten years. On January 29, THE UNSOLVABLE CASE made its way to you. Why you accepted it is unclear. Every officer and indeed most civilians in Jamrock know it's UNSOLVABLE.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Who do you think?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Who do you think?

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "You see two ticket stubs and a hand..."]
Damaged Ledger: "Outside you hear the wind howl. A s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Outside you hear the wind howl. A sudden gale blows in from Martinaise, flapping street signs and window blinds.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Your fingers are sweaty. There is a..."]
Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: ""Every step I take, it grows. By th..."]
You: ""THE HANGED MAN.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "THE HANGED MAN."

fields.Title: You: ""Kim, I have a name for this case.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, I have a name for this case."
fields.Alternate1: "Kim, I'm sorry. Let's name this case again, okay?"

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: (Variable["inventory.ledger_name_case_with_kim_later"]  or  Variable["inventory.ledger_left_without_naming_angered_kim"])  and  IsKimHere()  and  Variable["TASK.open_official_case_done"] == false

fields.Title: You: "Go on."
fields.Dialogue Text: Go on.

fields.Title: You: "I'm gonna have to knock on every do..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm gonna have to knock on every door and explain them how load bearing perpendiculars work?

fields.Title: You: "(Take it off.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: (Take it off.)

fields.Title: You: ""I speaketh the tongue.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I speaketh the tongue."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Boring? Try *dangerous*. You shoul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Boring? Try *dangerous*. You should do a thorough inventory of that -- make sure some has not fallen into the hands of the RCM's enemies: organized crime, or worse... Official notes sometimes contain informants' names, even undercover operatives."

fields.Title: You: ""Lieutenant, is this one of the *ho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Lieutenant, is this one of the *hologram watermarks* you mentioned?" (Point to the sticker.)

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "In the back you see thin translucen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In the back you see thin translucent copier paper -- some neon yellow, some bright red -- all covered in boxes, like marching armies. These look like official forms, waiting to be filled out...

fields.Title: You: "When I get the chance. (Accept.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: When I get the chance. (Accept.)

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Once in a while there's a red stamp..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Once in a while there's a red stamp that exclaims: CASE FILES; COMMIT TO PAPER. The *CASE FILES* themselves are plenty. You count more than a hundred sodden, crumpled up, earmarked pages falling apart in your hands. They appear to be sufficiently organized and extremely dense, if mostly illegible.

fields.Title: Half Light: "AND A FUCK YOU TO YOU *TOO*! That l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: AND A FUCK YOU TO YOU *TOO*! That last one cuts a slash right through the paper.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Huh?" He raises his nose from his..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Huh?" He raises his nose from his notes. "Two *complex* cases to undertake is a lot, yes. You *really* have to push yourself. I would not suggest it. Lest you start making mistakes."

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Written in a rush. In pain. A race..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Written in a rush. In pain. A race to beat your own heart's pulse to some dark finish line.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Get the body down.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Get the body down."

fields.Title: You: ""Why is that?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why is that?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Blue."
fields.Dialogue Text: Blue.

fields.Title: You: "Shake the ledger."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shake the ledger.

fields.Title: You: "Open the hidden compartment in the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Open the hidden compartment in the clipboard.
fields.tooltip1: Crack it on the knee like Burke!

fields.Title: Interfacing: "...is *not* what you end up doing...."
fields.Dialogue Text: ...is *not* what you end up doing. You squeeze the plastic to slide it open, but nothing happens. Then you bend it some. Then crack it. The god damn thing is stuck.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Hmm. The two sides of the board app..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hmm. The two sides of the board appear slightly misaligned. Like a drawer that's come off the slides. If you *bend* the plastic on your knee, slowly...
fields.Alternate1: Just relax. The two sides of the board are slightly misaligned. Like a drawer that's come off the slides. All you need to do is *bend* the plastic on your knee, slowly...

fields.Title: Interfacing: "...the slides *snap* back into plac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ...the slides *snap* back into place. It should be possible to just... you know...

fields.Title: You: "Fucking kill yourself you asshole."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fucking kill yourself you asshole.

fields.Title: You: "Throw the card in the wind."
fields.Dialogue Text: Throw the card in the wind.

fields.Title: You: "I'll take this outside. [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: I'll take this outside. [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: ""Go ahead.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Go ahead."

fields.Title: You: ""Solid name.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Solid name."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "It says: everyone look at me and my..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It says: everyone look at me and my *kitchen tissue* covered cop ledger! I don't *care*. My ledger is droopy and it smells like a urinal.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Like a fan of gills the chequered p..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Two?" He raises both eyebrows. "Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Two?" He raises both eyebrows. "That's a lot. I didn't mean to say you're making mistakes, by the way. That was presumptuous of me."
fields.Alternate1: "That's *a lot*. This kind of case load would explain your 'solved cases' tally, on the watermark..." He stops. "I didn't mean to say you're making mistakes, by the way. That was presumptuous of me."

fields.Title: You: ""Lieutenant, have you by any chance..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Lieutenant, have you by any chance *named* our case?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It would be *very* interesting to r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It would be *very* interesting to read about these, wouldn't it? I mean -- there seems to be a *square*-shaped entry wound in the victim's forehead. She's been sitting there for weeks. On her rocking chair. With a square hole in her skull, staring at the wall, her mouth agape.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Joseph Mills was on this case that..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Joseph Mills was on this case that he just couldn't solve. Was doing it solo. Said it was a real nutcracker. A real brain-twister. Was on it for, like, a month -- the captain got impatient. Shit or get off the pot, Mills.

fields.Title: You: "They actually looked like assholes."
fields.Dialogue Text: They actually looked like assholes.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Somewhere in a station lazareth lie..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Somewhere in a station lazareth lieutenant-detective Kitsuragi turns on the side and says: ouch. The wounds are agonizing.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "One day you may still catch the man..."
fields.Dialogue Text: One day you may still catch the man with the square gun.

fields.Title: You: "The option to sniff was there, so....."
fields.Dialogue Text: The option to sniff was there, so...

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Torturing your own nose -- for no r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Torturing your own nose -- for no reason! -- is not *conducive* to case-cracking, bud.

fields.Title: You: "[Put the ledger away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Put the ledger away.]

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The acidic stench of rotting food h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The acidic stench of rotting food has rubbed off on the cellulose. It now forms the *base* of the experience. This base surrounded by a faint air of spoiled meat -- the stuff of death itself! -- and then sprinkled liberally with the citrus zest of toilet cleaner.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know either..." He points..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know either..." He points to the ruined notes. "You should take stock of those, make sure it's all there. Official notes contain informants' names, undercover operatives even. If some of it has fallen into the hands of the RCM's adversaries, bloodletting may well ensue."
fields.Alternate1: "I don't know either..." He points to the ruined notes. "You should take stock of those, make sure it's all there. Official notes contain informants' names, undercover operatives even. If some of it has fallen into the hands of the RCM's adversaries, dark vibes may well ensue."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All RCM vehicles have headlights d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "All RCM vehicles have headlights designed to reveal halogen watermarks. Mine too."

fields.Title: You: "COMMIT TO PAPER."
fields.Dialogue Text: COMMIT TO PAPER.
fields.Alternate1: COMMIT TO PAPER -- using the pen Lena gave you.
fields.Alternate2: COMMIT TO PAPER -- using the pen lieutenant gave you.

fields.Title: You: "How much is that -- two new cases a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How much is that -- two new cases a week?

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["inventory.ledger_logic_case_a_week"] == true  and  IsKimHere() == false  and  Variable["inventory.ledger_asked_kim_about_case_tempo"] == false

fields.Title: You: "I don't wanna... (Back to the case..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't wanna... (Back to the case files.)

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's *inornate*. Nearly illegible,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's *inornate*. Nearly illegible, yet marching in orderly lines.

fields.Title: You: ""A nice brisk pace. The way I like..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A nice brisk pace. The way I like it."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The rest of the stinking cellulose..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The rest of the stinking cellulose is *much* worse for wear. Being sandwiched between the board and the rest of the paperwork must have spared the fragile copier paper.

fields.Title: You: "STATION CALL."
fields.Dialogue Text: STATION CALL.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, you mean the *titular*. Yes, w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, you mean the *titular*. Yes, well... So do I. In our defence -- almost everyone in the RCM does."

fields.Title: You: ""No. I don't know what you're talki..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No. I don't know what you're talking about."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Rail spike through the head. He di..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Rail spike through the head. He died. It was a work place accident."

fields.Title: You: "Read a case file."
fields.Dialogue Text: Read a case file.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
You: "Actually, I'm ready to admit I'm no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Actually, I'm ready to admit I'm not Raphal and go on with my life.

fields.Title: You: "I must have voted (and possibly eve..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I must have voted (and possibly even lobbied) to remove the thing because I don't believe in that rubbish one bit.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You would think that, but you're wr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You would think that, but you're wrong. Where's the fun in exposing your genitals, or breaking stuff in your own home? No, Leslie and Burke are on the corner of Main Street and Perdition, because that's where the *action* is.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Without resistance -- or sound -- t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Without resistance -- or sound -- the two panels move against each other. The compartment is now open.
fields.Alternate1: Without resistance -- or sound -- the two panels move against each other. The compartment is now open. Inside you see two ticket stubs.
fields.Alternate2: Without resistance -- or sound -- the two panels move against each other. The compartment is now open. Inside you see two ticket stubs and a handmade post card.

fields.Title: Shivers: "Frisson covers your entire body. A..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Frisson covers your entire body. A feeling of cold. A persistent chill.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Just like that the wind picks it fr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just like that the wind picks it from your fingers. Cold, they let go, the wax paper rustles, a whisper light and low... Then a sudden gust raises the postcard to the drizzle grey sky above. Away from you...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Huh? Oh, yes. The name, good. What..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Huh? Oh, yes. The name, good. What is it?"
fields.Alternate1: "Fine." He concedes. "For inter-district cooperation -- let's try one more time. What do you want to name it?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...something more concrete perhaps..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "...something more concrete perhaps? Do you have something *concrete*? Mundane. *Usual*."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh! That's actually what *I* was t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh! That's actually what *I* was thinking -- THE HANGED MAN." He nods. "I like that. A good, strong name. We have a very good name for the case now."

fields.Title: You: ""That's idiotic," (mockingly,) "*th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's idiotic," (mockingly,) "*the hanged man*. Way too simple."

fields.Title: You: "What was in there?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What was in there?

fields.Title: You: "Wait -- was Joseph Mills a good cop..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait -- was Joseph Mills a good cop?

fields.Title: You: "And every day is a day closer to th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And every day is a day closer to the day the building will fall.

fields.Title: You: "Okay, you're right, it doesn't."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, you're right, it doesn't.

fields.Title: You: "I like it, but can't we wreak havoc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I like it, but can't we wreak havoc on *other nations* instead?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "If you knew it was dunked in the to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If you knew it was dunked in the toilet before getting chucked into the trash, why're you sniffing it?

fields.Title: You: "Browse the *yellow* papers."
fields.Dialogue Text: Browse the *yellow* papers.
fields.Alternate1: Browse the forms again.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "An aluminium block runs the width o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An aluminium block runs the width of the board, biting down on the paperwork. Its crocodile teeth are the only thing keeping the papers together. A regular pencil, the tip worn down to nothing, has been attached to the clip.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It depends. Aside from an anti-cou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It depends. Aside from an anti-counterfeiting stamp, mine has my station number and address. The information varies by date of issue."

fields.Title: You: ""Hey lieutenant. What is this?" (Po..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey lieutenant. What is this?" (Point to the sticker.)

fields.Title: You: "(Count the pages.) I have to open a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Count the pages.) I have to open an official case. Is there room?

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "Colour of the irises. Predation mar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Colour of the irises. Predation marks. Condition of sexual organs.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The notebook is *annual*, it says '..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The notebook is *annual*, it says '51 on what remains of its cover -- a molten strap of cardboard. Everything prior to this must have belonged to a previous volume. In short: there was more.

fields.Title: You: "Return to the case files."
fields.Dialogue Text: Return to the case files.

fields.Title: You: "Back to the rest of this mess."
fields.Dialogue Text: Back to the rest of this mess.

fields.Title: You: "Horus Debby Berenger?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Horus Debby Berenger?
fields.Alternate1: Harry Debby Berenger?

fields.Title: You: "Those aren't my initials, I'm not *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Those aren't my initials, I'm not *feeling* them.

fields.Title: You: "The middle class are not to be blam..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The middle class are not to be blamed. It's *human nature*.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
Damaged Ledger: "The words just... *crossed* your mi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The words just... *crossed* your mind somehow.

fields.Title: You: "What?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What?

fields.Title: You: "Fall sideways."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fall sideways.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He flips the pages of his notebook...."
fields.Dialogue Text: He flips the pages of his notebook. "I'm going to start calling it THE HANGED MAN. It's good we sorted this out."

fields.Title: You: "Look at the ledger again."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look at the ledger again.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You had to lose because of *dark v..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You had to lose because of *dark vibes*? What are you talking about?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "YOU CAN'T! This is *your* ledger. Y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: YOU CAN'T! This is *your* ledger. You're a COP and it's your official ledger. It's filled out in *your* hand and it *stinks* like you too. And looks like you.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "No, he was awful. Awful sense of hu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, he was awful. Awful sense of humour too. The worst jokes you've ever heard. Really rapey. Still -- he'd been on it for *months* now. Said it was THE FINAL CASE. Said it was UNCRACKABLE. That the murderer vanished into THIN AIR. That goddamn hookah parlour was all he talked about.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "No, no, no, no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, no, no, no...

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
You: "Fine, then. I give up on Raphal..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fine, then. I give up on Raphal...

fields.Title: Logic: "Fine, then -- then you've earned it"
fields.Dialogue Text: Fine, then -- then you've earned it

fields.Title: Tutorial Agent: "The Ledger of Oblivion is a special..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The Ledger of Oblivion is a special item that can be used both as an INTERACTABLE and a TOOL equipped in your hand for skill bonuses. Find it under the TOOLS tab in your INVENTORY.

fields.Title: You: "Look at the clipboard."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look at the clipboard.

fields.Title: You: "Inspect the toilet paper."
fields.Dialogue Text: Inspect the toilet paper.

fields.Title: Empathy: "He's not mad -- that smelly mess of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's not mad -- that smelly mess of paper in your hand is making him worry about the well being of his own paperwork, that's all.

fields.Title: You: "Cross out the ones you've already f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Cross out the ones you've already finished.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Work. Strife. Poverty. The Jamrock..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Work. Strife. Poverty. The Jamrock Quarter. These are handwritten logs of investigations dating back to January '51, this year. The exact number is hard to estimate due to missing pages -- and an *odd* naming convention -- but there are at least twenty, maybe thirty cases. Undertaken, not completed, mind you.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yes. It appears you employ a... sha..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. It appears you employ a... shall we say *robust yet literary* system. Each investigation has its case number written on the margins. Yet, still more tellingly, most are accompanied by a *name*.

fields.Title: You: "Oh my, and they're written in capit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh my, and they're written in capital letters too...

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Does it? It feels like a *lot*. Or..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Does it? It feels like a *lot*. Or maybe even more than a lot. It feels like *too much*.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "A monetary penalization ranging fro..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A monetary penalization ranging from 20 to 250 rel. Severe cases allow for 1000 rel, but that requires special paperwork. The details of issuing these fines are spread out over the rest of the fields.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I prefer a *normal* case load." He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I prefer a *normal* case load." He turns back to his own case files. "It's a matter of methods."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Arson. Petty theft. Spousal abuse -..."]
Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Arson. Petty theft. Spousal abuse -..."]
You: ""Kim, my cases appear to employ som..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, my cases appear to employ some kind of... naming convention."
fields.Alternate1: "Kim, all my cases employ a naming convention similar to what we used on ours."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Like a fan of gills the chequered p..."]
Damaged Ledger: "Something rattles inside, ever so l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Something rattles inside, ever so lightly. Is there... a hidden compartment?

fields.Title: You: "But what is HDB?"
fields.Dialogue Text: But what is HDB?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "A touch of cinnamon, the end of sum..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A touch of cinnamon, the end of summer. You think the label says: 'Tutti Frutti'.

fields.Title: Shivers: "A small piece of paper dances above..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A small piece of paper dances above Martinaise -- above slow waves crashing the shore; and the war torn houses and the new *batiments nouveau* alike; above you, looking up to the grey sky with your hair greasy and wet..

fields.Title: Shivers: "And above the distant streets and t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And above the distant streets and the 8/81 -- even above the old fish market and the church. Its material existence is lost. This great city will pocket it for you. For your own sake -- forget about it.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Every step I take, it grows. By th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Every step I take, it grows. By the time I reach the fuel station it has filled me entirely. I step on the light rail and look back, sparks fall from the bow collector. I know it will be like this until late afternoon, when I get off the 42 -- and walk back to you..."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Ancient Reptilian Brain: "There is nothing."]
You: ""I'm not *feeling* it.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not *feeling* it."

fields.Title: You: "Put the ledger away. [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: Put the ledger away. [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: "Stop, put it back..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Stop, put it back...

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Sadly, the ledger only comes with a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sadly, the ledger only comes with an old worn-down led pencil. It's unfitting of this monumental event.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "God knows I've made my share... he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: God knows I've made my share... he tries not to think of them.

fields.Title: You: "One last time -- YES."
fields.Dialogue Text: One last time -- YES.

fields.Title: You: "Which toilet would that be?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Which toilet would that be?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Remember when I said the smell of t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Remember when I said the smell of the upstairs bathroom was so rank they should have sent a *poet* to describe it?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any case, we're lucky you found..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "In any case, we're lucky you found it. Make sure it's all in there. Official notes are... well they're dangerous, they contain confidentialities."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "I don't know... have you seen how *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't know... have you seen how *basic* that thing is? Basic clip, unglamorous toilet-smelling papers. It could've done with some *pizzazzo*! Anyway, go on. Sorry I said anything.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "A bunch of sodden papers sag from t..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""What?" He is lost in his own notes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What?" He is lost in his own notes. It takes a moment for him to see it. "That thing? It's a halogen watermark. We use it for adding information to RCM property."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Oh, and a *cool* piece of toilet pa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh, and a *cool* piece of toilet paper is stuck to the back.
fields.Alternate1: Oh, and an incredibly cool piece of *kitchen tissue* is stuck to the back.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Others appear more light-hearted: T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Others appear more light-hearted: THE GUYS ON A COUCH IN AN UNEXPECTED LOCATION and THE MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR, even the rare article-free COLLAPSING TENEMENT. Murder features prominently throughout.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Wish there was one in there about a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wish there was one in there about a drug den, you love those. Gets the *blood* pumping.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "It's not exactly poetry -- but poet..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's not exactly poetry -- but poetry would be out of place.

fields.Title: Logic: "...then *rip* them from the binder,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ...then *rip* them from the binder, and hand them out. According to type of form.

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "All in a print so small it could be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All in a print so small it could be considered downright *cute*.

fields.Title: You: "MISCONDUCT FINE."
fields.Dialogue Text: MISCONDUCT FINE.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "You don't have to be an intellectua..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You don't have to be an intellectual giant to do police-work.

fields.Title: You: "That's *it*?"
fields.Dialogue Text: That's *it*?

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Probably for the best. Because HDB..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Probably for the best. Because HDB feels like *bad news* from yesteryear. Like shit, honcho.

fields.Title: Logic: "It's safe to say those are the init..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's safe to say those are the initials of the officer responsible for the case -- *your* initials.

fields.Title: You: "Proceed."
fields.Dialogue Text: Proceed.

fields.Title: You: "Pick up the card. (Proceed.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: Pick up the card. (Proceed.)
fields.Alternate1: Pick up the card again -- now that you're outside.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Your hand shakes, holding the card...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your hand shakes, holding the card. "Every morning when I step out and you're asleep behind me," it says. "I find a little piece of sadness in me. I carry it in my chest down Voyager Road..."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The wind carries the keepsake away..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The wind carries the keepsake away from you -- to the southwest, the pale violet dot disappears.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Great! That's great. That's actual..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Great! That's great. That's actually what *I* was thinking too -- THE HANGED MAN. Good, strong name. We have a very good name for the case now."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Kim Kitsuragi: "He flips the pages of his notebook...."]
Damaged Ledger: "No. You should not have thought bac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. You should not have thought back at it... Now some of it is on your mind again.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
You: "What can I do?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What can I do?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No -- actually. Any ideas?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "No -- actually. Any ideas?"

fields.Title: You: "Right. On with the murder."
fields.Dialogue Text: Right. On with the murder.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Exactly. These notes have been very..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Exactly. These notes have been very clear. Seems you have been thorough with documenting this one. So -- which one of these do you want to read *next*? (Because there is nothing you can do about THE COLLAPSING TENEMENT).

fields.Title: You: "But?"
fields.Dialogue Text: But?

fields.Title: Endurance: "Not you. You are an *eternal machin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not you. You are an *eternal machine*.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "A tool for manipulation. Give the l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A tool for manipulation. Give the lowest amount and people will be ingratiated to you.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's just toilet paper, sticking to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's just toilet paper, sticking to the back of the plastic clipboard. You can take it off if you want.

fields.Title: You: "Is "sprinkled liberally with the ci..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Is "sprinkled liberally with the citrus zest of toilet cleaner" a line this poet might have used?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Maybe you should pay more attention..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe you should pay more attention then? Anyway, what your nose is trying tell you is -- the ledger was dropped into a toilet in the Whirling-in-Rags, by you. The toilet cleaner in your room smells exactly the same.

fields.Title: You: ""Someone from the Whirling threw it..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Someone from the Whirling threw it in the trash? I don't know. I'm boring."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do-eth thou also thorough inventor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do-eth thou also thorough inventories?" He points to the ruined notes. "You should take stock of those. Official notes contain informants' names, undercover operatives even. If some of it has fallen into the hands of the RCM's adversaries, bloodletting may well ensue."
fields.Alternate1: "Do-eth thou also *thorough inventories*?" He points to the ruined notes. "You should take stock of those. Official notes contain informants' names, undercover operatives even. If some of it has fallen into the hands of the RCM's adversaries, dark vibes may well ensue."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "To be honest: you have little to no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: To be honest: you have little to no idea. You're dumb. And alone.

fields.Title: You: ""Kim, do you have a pen?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, do you have a pen?"

fields.Title: You: ""Two cases a week appears to have b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Two cases a week appears to have been my load, lieutenant. I'm not sure I completed them though."

fields.Title: Authority: "What delicious power hid within thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What delicious power hid within this pathetic mess... you feel better.

fields.Title: You: ""That's the one." (Lie.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's the one." (Lie.)

fields.Title: You: ""I seem to have named a case "THE S..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I seem to have named a case "THE SQUARE BULLET HOLE MURDERS."

fields.Title: Logic: "*Feeling* isn't really the jurisdic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Feeling* isn't really the jurisdiction we're in right now.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Yeah, we're staying out of this bus..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, we're staying out of this business for now. HDB is *bad news* from yesteryear. It's shit, honcho.

fields.Title: Logic: "It takes about half an hour to piec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It takes about half an hour to piece one together, using the system you've devised. Where do you want to start?

fields.Title: You: "I think what you *meant* to say was..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I think what you *meant* to say was RAC -- *Raphal Ambrosius Costeau*.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
You: "THE COUCH IN AN UNEXPECTED LOCATION"
fields.Dialogue Text: THE COUCH IN AN UNEXPECTED LOCATION

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Leslie will always take his pants o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Leslie will always take his pants off when he's drunk. Burke will always trash everything. It's just what they do. It is their nature -- you cannot change the nature of a man. And you can't lock them away, because public indecency and small-scale property damage are not punishable by incarceration.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "In the process the ledger sustains..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In the process the ledger sustains damage. The compartment within -- reserved for permeable documents -- is jammed shut. You stop your assault on the now unconscious Burke to open it, but are unable to do so. *The officer began to cry*, reports Leslie, who at this point is tending to Burke.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Which is also why the officer respo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Which is also why the officer responsible (narrowly) escapes a disciplinary hearing. The end. Do you want to read another one?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Thin wax paper has been glued to a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Thin wax paper has been glued to a piece of cardboard. Sounds like leaves rustling when you pick it up -- you see violet flowers, floral patterns, patches of glue.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "A merciful wind blows in from the B..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A merciful wind blows in from the Bay of Revachol, dusting the ground at your feet and raising newspapers far away. You feel the card slipping into it...
fields.Alternate1: No! A merciful wind blows in from the Bay of Revachol, dusting the ground at your feet and raising newspapers far away. You feel the card slipping into it... now that you're out! Let go...

fields.Title: You: "What's inside?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What's inside?

fields.Title: You: "Throw the card in the wind."
fields.Dialogue Text: Throw the card in the wind.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Your hands shake holding on to it...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your hands shake holding on to it. "Every morning, when I step out and you're asleep behind me," it says. "I find a little piece of sadness in me. I carry it in my chest down Voyager road..."

fields.Title: You: ""THE SETTING SUN.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "THE SETTING SUN."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You stare at the card, willing your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You stare at the card, willing your hand to move. It refuses. It's too much. Not again.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Needless. It looks great. Unlike yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Needless. It looks great. Unlike yours, which is an unholy mass dripping with excrement.

fields.Title: You: "Don't mention it."
fields.Dialogue Text: Don't mention it.

fields.Title: Logic:"Harry Du Bois -- H.D.B."
fields.Dialogue Text: Harry Du Bois -- H.D.B.

fields.Title: You: "Wait -- how?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait -- how?

fields.Title: You: "And what was he *doing* there -- fo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And what was he *doing* there -- for six hours?

fields.Title: You: "If it hasn't, it won't. I was wrong..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If it hasn't, it won't. I was wrong.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Insufferable dicks. Young people ar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Insufferable dicks. Young people are the worst.  So anyway -- you got a complaint about the damn sofa. Or couch. Or whatever it was.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "...while a bunch of sodden papers s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ...while a bunch of sodden papers sag from the clipboard in your hand. It's a sorry sight.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Which is also why the officer respo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Which is also why the officer responsible (narrowly) escapes a disciplinary hearing. The end.

fields.Title: You: ""I think I didn't want to be a cop..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I think I didn't want to be a cop anymore."
fields.Alternate1: "I think I didn't want to be a cop anymore -- so I flushed my career down the toilet, literally."

fields.Title: You: ""It has a.. foreboding quality to i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It has a.. foreboding quality to it. Maybe I *needed* to lose it, for the great bloodletting to begin..."

fields.Title: Empathy: "He's sorry for you."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's sorry for you.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." There is a pause. "RCM vehic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes." There is a pause. "RCM vehicles have headlights tuned especially to reveal halogen watermarks."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "A bunch of sodden papers sag from t..."]
Damaged Ledger: "Not good. A bunch of sodden papers..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not good. A bunch of sodden papers sags from the clipboard in your hand.

fields.Title: Logic: "Once all the tasks are accomplished..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Once all the tasks are accomplished, the case is complete.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "But they appear... pleasantly vague..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But they appear... pleasantly vague.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well... so do I. In our defence, o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well... so do I. In our defence, officer, almost everyone in the RCM does."

fields.Title: Jump to: [You: "How long does it take to read a cas..."]
You: "Hram Darjan Binzakin?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Hram Darjan Binzakin?
fields.Alternate1: Harry Darjan Binzakin?

fields.Title: Logic: "Yes! You can piece them together us..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes! You can piece them together using the alphanumeric code on the margin. It always begins with HDB41, then date of initialization and time of arrival on the scene. Followed by the title. For example: HDB41120117:00 (THE NEXT WORLD MURAL).
fields.Alternate1: Yes! At last you find a way to piece them together using the alphanumeric code on the margin -- HDB41, date of initialization and time of arrival on the scene. Followed by the title. For example: HDB41120117:00 (THE NEXT WORLD MURAL).

fields.Title: Logic: "Forty one is your precinct."
fields.Dialogue Text: Forty one is your precinct.

fields.Title: You: "THE UNSOLVABLE CASE"
fields.Dialogue Text: THE UNSOLVABLE CASE

fields.Title: You: "B) KEEP THE MURAL, IT IS RIGHT"
fields.Dialogue Text: B) KEEP THE MURAL, IT IS RIGHT

fields.Title: Logic: "Can you keep *yourself* off the str..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Can you keep *yourself* off the streets?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "He must have it confused with the *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He must have it confused with the *property* he likes to damage. But the joke's on him -- you're also drunk. Drunk out of your mind on Potent Pilsner. You slam the hardened plastic board in his face; then proceed to beat him unconscious with it.
fields.Alternate1: He must have it confused with the *property* he likes to damage. But the joke's on him -- the officer is also drunk. Way more drunk than Burke there, and let's be fair, you also have *party eyes*. You slam the hardened plastic board in his face, then proceed to beat him unconscious with it.

fields.Title: Logic: "Permeables. It's not hidden per se,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Permeables. It's not hidden per se, the compartment is made for permeable materials that would get damaged if something happened to it.

fields.Title: Half Light: "A hot flash of rage comes over you...."
fields.Dialogue Text: A hot flash of rage comes over you. For a moment there -- before it recedes -- you feel as though you might just squeeze a tear of anger out of your duct. Makes you wonder... why?

fields.Title: You: "Wait... somehow I don't want to."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait... somehow I don't want to.

fields.Title: You: "Keep reading."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep reading.

fields.Title: You: ""SHIT ON A STICK.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "SHIT ON A STICK."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh... Well, then maybe I can sugge..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh... Well, then maybe I can suggest one?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""THE HANGED MAN.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "THE HANGED MAN."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay then." He returns to his note..."]
Jump to: [Half Light: "Your hand shakes. You're flushed wi..."]
Damaged Ledger: "No one enters -- no one exits. He's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No one enters -- no one exits. He's just sucking on his watermelon hookah all morning, all noon, like he usually does. (He's a regular). No calls, nothing. Just sucking on the hookah, until 15.45. Then bam -- he's dead on floor with his skull busted open, blood everywhere. What happened? How can it be?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "That's all you got. From the half h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's all you got. From the half hour you've spent piecing it together, all you know is: the entry wound was square-shaped. You never found the bullet. And then -- another body showed up. Also with a square hole in his forehead.

fields.Title: You: "A sequence killer?"
fields.Dialogue Text: A sequence killer?

fields.Title: Empathy: "Strange? Why does it make you so an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Strange? Why does it make you so angry?

fields.Title: You: "Slide the drawer open."
fields.Dialogue Text: Slide the drawer open.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "How many years you've been on the f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How many years you've been on the force, he's thinking. It'll have that.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Still feels like there's *something..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Still feels like there's *something* missing from that...

fields.Title: You: "Maybe, uh -- maybe it's my fetish?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe, uh -- maybe it's my fetish? Maybe? Ever think of that, nose?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "A bunch of sodden papers sag from t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A bunch of sodden papers sag from the clipboard in your hand. It's a sorry sight.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You had to lose it for *the bloodl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You had to lose it for *the bloodletting* to begin? What are you talking about?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "After a while he can't take it anym..."
fields.Dialogue Text: After a while he can't take it anymore. "Excuse me, I just have to ask again -- *how* did it get in the trash?"
fields.Alternate1: After a while he can't take it anymore. "Excuse me, I just have to ask again -- *how* could you have let this get tossed out?"

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "Looks like an official mark, made t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Looks like an official mark, made to be low visibility outside the right circumstances.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What?" He is lost in his own notes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What?" He is lost in his own notes. It takes a moment for him to see it. "Yes, a halogen watermark used for adding information to RCM property."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay." He returns to his neatly ke..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay." He returns to his neatly kept notes...

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "You start scratching the tasks you'..."]
You: "FIELD AUTOPSY."
fields.Dialogue Text: FIELD AUTOPSY.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Wearing out. Nearly gone. Sometimes..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wearing out. Nearly gone. Sometimes he forgets to keep the pen on the paper as he moves his hand and the lines vanish from underneath...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Arson. Petty theft. Spousal abuse -..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Arson. Petty theft. Spousal abuse -- handwritten logs on investigations dating back to January, 51 -- stamped CASE FILES, COMMIT TO PAPER. These are the last couple of months of your life.
fields.Alternate1: Arson. Petty theft. Spousal abuse -- handwritten logs on dozens of investigations date back to January, '51 -- stamped CASE FILES; COMMIT TO PAPER. These are your last couple of months in Revachol, Precinct 41, Jamrock Quarter.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Again, in your defence, I seem to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Again, in your defence, I seem to have named one..." He peeks into his notes. "THE MAN WITH THE HOLE IN HIS HEAD. That was a real person, his death was real. Still I named it that. To amuse myself."

fields.Title: You: "Peek inside."
fields.Dialogue Text: Peek inside.

fields.Title: Logic: "Yeah... no."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah... no.

fields.Title: You: "And HDB..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And HDB...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "People call it *that thing* and *th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: People call it *that thing* and *that fucking thing*. Its visible for miles. In two days the station's complaints desk gets clogged with requests to remove *The Bummer*. You and your partner are assigned to the case.

fields.Title: You: "Read on."
fields.Dialogue Text: Read on.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Familiar handwriting lines the insi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Familiar handwriting lines the inside of the card -- looped, round letters in a woman's hand.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Furies. Yes. Well." It's obvious h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Furies. Yes. Well." It's obvious he doesn't like it. "I don't know. I have to be honest -- I'm not experiencing the *internal strife* that refers to. And also..." He furrows his brow.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Kim Kitsuragi: "He flips the pages of his notebook...."]
Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Like a fan of gills the chequered p..."]
Damaged Ledger: "You start scratching the tasks you'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You start scratching the tasks you've completed onto the paper with a brash freehand uncannily similar to the rest of the letters. The wording comes easily, it's almost robotically simple; a language developed for mental rigour and simplicity:

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Smoking hookah. Didn't you hear? I..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Smoking hookah. Didn't you hear? I don't know. Trying to come up with a movie script maybe. Anyway, that was MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR, Joseph Mills wasn't a good detective, and about 30 minutes has passed piecing it together. Next?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "And it's not pretty in the apartmen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And it's not pretty in the apartment either. By the time you arrive the husband's left. His wife has got her lip busted, face swollen. Eyes shut. Can't leave him, they're a *financial unit*. Enjoying this beautiful life in this beautiful tenement.

fields.Title: You: "I'm gonna have to find my captain s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm gonna have to find my captain somewhere, first thing tomorrow. Maybe even *tonight*.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
You: "And when it does, everyone in there..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And when it does, everyone in there will die.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "At the end of the day -- no one kno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: At the end of the day -- no one knows. The math says it *must* collapse. And the optics show that it doesn't. It's as if some kind of *evil spirit* is holding the tenement together, like the jaws of a trap. Luring the people back in. One by one. Already they're going... At least 40 of them are living there now.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Without resistance -- or sound -- t..."]
Damaged Ledger: "The Ledger of (Oblivion Induced) Me..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The Ledger of (Oblivion Induced) Mental Health is just as shabby as the Damaged Ledger was: a bunch of sodden papers sags from the clipboard in your hand.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel the air sucked out of your lungs and the blood sucked out of your head. Everything around you gets dark. Small white dots appear...

fields.Title: Logic: "Maybe yours will have how many case..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe yours will have how many cases you've solved?

fields.Title: You: "Inspect the clip."
fields.Dialogue Text: Inspect the clip.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "It says: everyone look at me and my..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It says: everyone look at me and my toilet paper covered cop ledger! I don't *care*. My ledger is droopy and it smells like a urinal. Not a new addition, though. So keep that *styling case* open, my friend...

fields.Title: You: "Not really."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not really.

fields.Title: Composure: "Easier said than done -- how could..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Easier said than done -- how could this pathetic mess of copy paper and plastic ever become *trs disco*?"

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "It is -- look at how basic that thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It is -- look at how basic that thing is! Basic clip, unglamorous toilet-smelling papers. It could do with some *pizzazzo*" Cheer you right up.

fields.Title: You: "Run your finger across the aluminiu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Run your finger across the aluminium.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Absolutely motionless at first, the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Absolutely motionless at first, then animated slowly, imperceptibly even, the lieutenant begins to browse his notes again. Leaving you to the case files.

fields.Title: You: "(Back to the case files.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: (Back to the case files.)

fields.Title: Logic: "A lot? A little? You have no idea,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A lot? A little? You have no idea, this all depends.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "These are quite sinister in tone. T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: These are quite sinister in tone. They give a date and time for the person to 'appear' at the specified Precinct Police Station. Below the 'call' are the criminal charges you risk by 'not appearing'.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Arson. Petty theft. Spousal abuse -..."]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean the alphanumeric -- offic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You mean the alphanumeric -- officer, precinct, time of arrival at the scene?"

fields.Title: Logic: "I got nothing here either. Logic re..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I got nothing here either. Logic really isn't the best faculty to have this conversation with, But it's the one you got, so sorry.

fields.Title: Logic: "It's possible: yes. Easy: no. You n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's possible: yes. Easy: no. You need to come up with a small archaeological system to re-order the remains of your past works. At the moment all they do is fall apart in your hands. Some dates and the numeric titular system is all you have.
fields.Alternate1: It's proving to be harder than expected. You just don't have the intellectual rigour to patch the quilt back together -- try again later?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Good, you're learning. If the files..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Good, you're learning. If the files are to be trusted -- that's all there is to it. That and Burke breaking things. And the fact that they're both drunk. But then again, so are you. The case becomes *considerably* less comic one day, when Burke takes a swing at your ledger.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Can't get out of his apartment. An..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Can't get out of his apartment. An invalid. With Burke to tend to, Leslie cuts back on the indecent exposure. Maybe he flashes his genitals to Burke, who knows, but both drunks are off the street. The complaints stop, the unsolvable case is solved.

fields.Title: You: "Who were they for?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Who were they for?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Two octopuses are smiling, reaching..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Two octopuses are smiling, reaching their tentacles toward each other in the coloured pencil drawings. The tickets permit access to a zoo in Revachol East. The aquarium costs extra -- these let you go there too.
fields.Alternate1: Two octopuses are smiling, reaching their tentacles toward each other in the coloured pencil drawings. The tickets permit access to a zoo in Revachol East. The aquarium costs extra -- they let you go there too. You should go and kill yourself there.

fields.Title: Shivers: "LET GO."
fields.Dialogue Text: LET GO.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Two ticket stubs and a handmade pos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Two ticket stubs and a handmade postcard.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Synapses can be rerouted. The mind..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Synapses can be rerouted. The mind takes a new shape.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay then." He returns to his note..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay then." He returns to his notes, abruptly. "The case doesn't need to have a name."

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
Damaged Ledger: "You jam the compartment shut, it's..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You jam the compartment shut, it's hard to breathe. The air in your lungs feels sour somehow. The drawer is locked, blue ink drips from the white pages in your hand.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "The tasks you've completed flow out..."]
Logic:"Harrier Du Bois -- H.D.B."
fields.Dialogue Text: Harrier Du Bois -- H.D.B.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "MURDER -- tam-tam-tam! -- AT THE HO..."
fields.Dialogue Text: MURDER -- tam-tam-tam! -- AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR! was a case originally assigned to an officer called Joseph Mills, who is now dead. Of circumstances completely unconnected to MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Okay, so the case is handed to you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, so the case is handed to you because Mills isn't getting anywhere. And you look into it. Here's the set-up: A young man is found dead in a hookah parlour. You know, those places where you go and smoke bubblegum-flavoured vapour all day.

fields.Title: You: "Really cool."
fields.Dialogue Text: Really cool.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "No, it's soot and water vapour. It..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, it's soot and water vapour. It doesn't do anything.

fields.Title: You: "I'm gonna have to go home and do no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm gonna have to go home and do nothing, not think about this ever again.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "They were leaving it out in all the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They were leaving it out in all these *unexpected and whimsical locations* they took it to. Where they also took photos of themselves -- on it. And smoked cigarettes. And drank coffee, because they felt it's *intellectual*.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "No, you don't -- not without offici..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, you don't -- not without official police backup. It's simply impossible to open it. Your hands refuse to move.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "There's pain in there, if you want..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's pain in there, if you want some. That much you know.

fields.Title: You: "How would I open it? (Conclude.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: How would I open it? (Conclude.)

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You don't exactly *close* them, so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You don't exactly *close* them, so much as *distance* yourself from the smelly papers. They're a little further from your nose now.

fields.Title: Tutorial Agent: "The Ledger of Oblivion is a special..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The Ledger of Oblivion is a special item that can be used both as an INTERACTABLE and a TOOL equipped in your hand for skill bonuses. Find it under the TOOLS tab in your INVENTORY.

fields.Title: You: "Anything *else*?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Anything *else*?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Still wet, the toilet paper -- I me..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Still wet, the toilet paper -- I mean *kitchen tissue*, sorry -- peels off the plastic easily. All you have to do is shake it off your finger, and voil, the ledger now looks (marginally) better.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant observes you raising..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant observes you raising and lowering the toilet-water-logged mass under your nose, trying to get a good whiff. A good *analytical* whiff.

fields.Title: You: ""It has a.. foreboding quality to i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It has a.. foreboding quality to it. I'm picking up dark vibes. Maybe I *had* to lose it?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The surface is interrupted by a sil..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The surface is interrupted by a silvery *sticker*. It's rectangular, sparkling with iridescence. You don't know how you didn't notice it before...

fields.Title: You: ""That's all, thank you." (Conclude...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's all, thank you." (Conclude.)

fields.Title: You: "Enough of these. (Close forms.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: Enough of these. (Close forms.)

fields.Title: You: "Let it be."
fields.Dialogue Text: Let it be.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good, yes. We can return to the de..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good, yes. We can return to the dead body -- by now it smells *exquisite*..." Looks like he would rather concentrate on taking notes for now.

fields.Title: You: "I'm done inspecting these. (Close t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm done inspecting these. (Close the case files.)

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "What do you mean? Is that *all*?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What do you mean? Is that *all*?

fields.Title: You: "Wow. I don't know what to say to th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wow. I don't know what to say to that.

fields.Title: Logic: "That... is improbable."
fields.Dialogue Text: That... is improbable.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "This one is relatively easy to reco..."
