fields.Dialogue Text: This one is relatively easy to reconstruct. Overnight on 12/02. a graffito -- nay, a mural! -- appears on an eight story tenement overlooking Central Jamrock. The building is a sparsely inhabited ghost tower, part of a failed real estate development called Grand Couron.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The nine thousand people subjected..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The nine thousand people subjected to the murals message -- all of Lakeside (Central Jamrock) and Villalobos, plus half of the Eminent Domain -- participate in the vote. Although the case begins with what appears to be a lot of rumbling on the streets as to how juvenile and stupid the mural is, given a choice between two options...

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "You were so drunk you didn't rememb..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You were so drunk you didn't remember what it was when you signed on. That, or you were high.

fields.Title: You: "Couldn't we just keep them off the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Couldn't we just keep them off the streets?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""You, you... Every step I take will..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You, you... Every step I take will get lighter. It almost makes me run! Sometimes I do. I can't believe I met you. I can't believe the happiness I feel with you. You have a vast, vast soul and I will always, always, always come back to it."

fields.Title: Endurance: "To what? There's nothing..."
fields.Dialogue Text: To what? There's nothing...

fields.Title: Empathy: "He really likes that name."
fields.Dialogue Text: He really likes that name.

fields.Title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I -- or someone el..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm pretty sure I -- or someone else -- dropped it into the toilet in my hostel room bathroom. The tablet's the same." (Tap on your nose.)
fields.Alternate1: "Sylvie found my papers clogging the toilet, so she threw them away."

fields.Title: Half Light: "Oh god, that sounds dangerous. Make..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh god, that sounds dangerous. Make sure you don't throw it out again.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "But, you see, it's *freezing* outsi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But, you see, it's *freezing* outside. And there is no municipal government in Revachol. Nowhere to put these people. Two hundred people can't go to their *aunt's for a couple of days*. And above all -- there is no one to *tell* the building is coming down. No authority but you.

fields.Title: You: "And then what?"
fields.Dialogue Text: And then what?

fields.Title: You: "They looked really cool. Like model..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They looked really cool. Like models.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Don't worry. One day."
fields.Dialogue Text: Don't worry. One day.

fields.Title: Horrific Necktie: "Fun is *outlawed* with this guy. Wh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fun is *outlawed* with this guy. What a narc.

fields.Title: Logic: "Does that sound like a Raphal Some..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Does that sound like a Raphal Something Costeau to you, sir?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant clears his throat. "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant clears his throat. "I don't think this is the time to be going through personal affects," he says. "Let's move on."

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Your nose is somewhere between grat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your nose is somewhere between grateful and resentful.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Still wet, the toilet paper peels o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Still wet, the toilet paper peels off the plastic easily. All you have to do is shake it off your finger and voila! The ledger now looks (marginally) better.

fields.Title: You: ""Yeah, I still don't want to discus..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yeah, I still don't want to discuss it."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Challenge accepted. You should be o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Challenge accepted. You should be on the lookout for stylistic elements that elevate this cabbage to heights unforeseeable.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, good." There is a moment's s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay, good." There is a moment's silence. "But *why*?"
fields.Alternate1: "Okay, good." There is a moment's silence. "But *why* were they there in the first place?"

fields.Title: Logic: "It is similar to the RCM watermark..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It is similar to the RCM watermark on your blazer the lieutenant mentioned. Didn't he say something about the headlights of his motor carriage? That you can read these there?

fields.Title: You: ""Can I have one?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Can I have one?"

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "A *title* one might say even. One t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A *title* one might say even. One that draws inspiration from snoop fiction and Vespertine cop show staples.

fields.Title: You: "What types of forms are there?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What types of forms are there?

fields.Title: You: ""No, I mean a... *non-numeric* one...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, I mean a... *non-numeric* one. With titles."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Right, what more do you need? A rub..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Right, what more do you need? A rubber condom stuck to the back? A graffito that says 'DEFEATED'? I think you catch the drift.

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "There's something there. A rectangu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's something there. A rectangular shape, like a card. Or a postcard...

fields.Title: Logic: "Why yes. Your precinct number is 41..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why yes. Your precinct number is 41.

fields.Title: You: "Wait! What is HDB41?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait! What is HDB41?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "TRUE LOVE IS POSSIBLE ONLY IN THE..."
fields.Dialogue Text:
TRUE LOVE IS POSSIBLE
ONLY IN THE NEXT WORLD -- FOR NEW PEOPLE
IT IS TOO LATE FOR US

WREAK HAVOC ON THE MIDDLE CLASS

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The graffito crew is easy to track..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The graffito crew is easy to track down. Only the Belles Lettres have the *literage* of industrial paint to cover the surface. (One of the graffito artists is rumoured to be *rich*.) They take responsibility for the execution, but not the design. The ideologue of the *Next World Mural* -- as the crew calls it -- remains an unknown.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The only way for Leslie to stop dis..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The only way for Leslie to stop displaying his genitals, and for Burke to stop attacking things, would be for them to *stop drinking alcohol*. Which in their forties, or fifties -- it's hard to tell because of their distorted features -- is a medical improbability.
fields.Alternate1: The only way for Leslie to stop flashing his genitals to by-passers, and for Burke to stop dismantling signage and rear view mirrors, would be for them to *stop drinking alcohol*. Which, in their forties, or fifties -- it's hard to tell because of their distorted features -- is a medical improbability on par with you ceasing to produce *The Expression*.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "The fucking drunks, it's their faul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The fucking drunks, it's their fault. You should've drunk the liquor out of that fucker's SKULL...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The ledger quivers in your hand. As..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The ledger quivers in your hand. As it shakes the pages rustle. This pathetic mess suddenly afraid of you for some reason.

fields.Title: You: "Fuck no -- put the ledger away. [Le..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fuck no -- put the ledger away. [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: "Close the permeables' compartment."
fields.Dialogue Text: Close the permeables' compartment.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "(Cause of failure: rent too high.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: (Cause of failure: rent too high.)

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "He must have it confused with the *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He must have it confused with the *property* he likes to damage. But the joke's on him -- you're drunk out of your mind on Potent Pilsner. You slam the hardened plastic board in his face. Then you proceed to beat him unconscious with it.
fields.Alternate1: He must have it confused with the *property* he likes to damage. But the joke's on him -- the officer is also drunk. Way more drunk than Burke there, and let's be fair, you also have *party eyes*. You slam the hardened plastic board in his face, then proceed to beat him unconscious with it.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Your fingers are sweaty. There is a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your fingers are sweaty. There is a sweat mark where they held the wax paper. The card lies next to the ticket stubs.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It smells of chewing gum -- apricot..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It smells of chewing gum -- apricot flavoured.

fields.Title: You: "Hold on to it. Read the card."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hold on to it. Read the card.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "No! Don't throw away the baggie! Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No! Don't throw away the baggie! There's dust on the drug baggie! It's not good but at least it's *some* kind of way to be together...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could we make it less *poetic* som..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Could we make it less *poetic* somehow? Just a normal case name, you know? Think -- what would that be? A good *normal* name?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [Damaged Ledger: "Like a fan of gills the chequered p..."]
You: "Put it away!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Put it away!

fields.Title: You: "No matter. I'll just use the pencil..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No matter. I'll just use the pencil...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, if you'll excuse me..." He re..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now, if you'll excuse me..." He reopens his own *pristine* blue notebook. "That thing has filled me with the sudden urge to make sure mine is in *perfect* order."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Your secret is safe with the rotten..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your secret is safe with the rotten cabbage of papers in your hand. Writing covers almost all the pages.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "So anyway -- you take a leak before..."
fields.Dialogue Text: So anyway -- you take a leak before you leave.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Right from the foundation -- up to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Right from the foundation -- up to the eighth floor.

fields.Title: Half Light: "Fucking hell."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fucking hell.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Bad, bad thoughts go through your h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Bad, bad thoughts go through your head. So what you do is -- you call your partner. JV (only initials available) is up. He comes immediately. He didn't take building safety, but he believes you. He brings five more officers. Together you knock on *every door* and explain the situation.

fields.Title: You: "Oh god, I don't know..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh god, I don't know...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Some assholes brought their couch o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Some assholes brought their couch outside and *hung out* on it. In the middle of the street, on the roof, on the hillside by the motorway. You know -- at an *unexpected location*. They were young and they thought they looked cool on it.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Cigarette butts, coffee cups, stupi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Cigarette butts, coffee cups, stupid couch. You had to clean it all up. And you *did* -- so congratulations to you. Case solved.

fields.Title: You: "This is getting weird and hostile...."
fields.Dialogue Text: This is getting weird and hostile. Sorry, nose -- let's just move on.

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "It's not though. It's toilet paper."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's not though. It's toilet paper.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "It says: everyone look at me and my..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It says: everyone look at me and my toilet paper covered cop ledger! I don't *care*. My ledger is droopy and it smells like a urinal.

fields.Title: You: "Ignorantly pass through the eighth..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ignorantly pass through the eighth thousandth sign that it's yours.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, however damaged -- that....."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Officer, however damaged -- that..." he points to it, "...is still an official piece of paperwork. It probably contains notes on *numerous* ongoing investigations. It could even list undercover operatives. Certainly informants. I suggest integrating it into your *style*. For all our sakes."

fields.Title: You: ""Interesting. What kind of informat..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Interesting. What kind of information?"

fields.Title: Empathy: "The lieutenant would rather not hav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant would rather not have you rummaging around, looking for the lights in his vehicle...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "There is -- for precisely *one* mor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There is -- for precisely *one* more. Fifteen pages near the end remain untouched by the damage. The chequered grid forms a structure of passages, breaking the case into sub-tasks to accomplish.

fields.Title: Empathy: "The threat has passed. He is thankf..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The threat has passed. He is thankful it has passed, and that he's gotten to keep both pens.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Know that I give this to you..." H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Know that I give this to you..." He pulls one from the loop. "...with *resentment*."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yes, all caps. One is called THE NE..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, all caps. One is called THE NEXT WORLD MURAL, another THE SQUARE BULLET HOLE MURDERS. Another yet: THE UNSOLVABLE CASE.

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "Judging by the creases on your fore..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Judging by the creases on your forehead and the lines on your cheeks -- too much more. Going back years, decades even....

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "There's something there. A rectangu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's something there. A rectangular shape, like one of those *postcards* that Annette told you about...

fields.Title: Logic: "It takes about half an hour to piec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It takes about half an hour to piece one together, using the system you've devised. Which one do you want?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Not much has changed in the meanwhi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not much has changed in the meanwhile -- a bunch of sodden papers still sags from the clipboard.

fields.Title: You: "A) REMOVE THE MURAL, IT IS WRONG"
fields.Dialogue Text: A) REMOVE THE MURAL, IT IS WRONG

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "A staggering seventy-eight percent..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A staggering seventy-eight percent of voters choose to keep it. Turns out the opposition were a loud minority. And that love truly is possible in the next world -- for new people. And it is too late for us.

fields.Title: You: "Property damage."
fields.Dialogue Text: Property damage.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's slightly -- ever so slightly -..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's slightly -- ever so slightly -- difficult to breathe once you've done so. The drawer is locked, blue ink drips from the white pages in your hand.

fields.Title: Volition: "Throw it away. Please."
fields.Dialogue Text: Throw it away. Please.

fields.Title: Authority: "For the eighty thousand under your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: For the eighty thousand under your jurisdiction.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Sparks fall like snow from the bow..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sparks fall like snow from the bow collector. A street-car distancing...

fields.Title: You: ""THE FURIES ARE AT HOME IN THE MIRR..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "THE FURIES ARE AT HOME IN THE MIRROR."

fields.Title: You: ""Actually, I don't have one.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Actually, I don't have one."
fields.Alternate1: "I don't have another name."

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "You."
fields.Dialogue Text: You.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "See! You can't even *read* the thin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: See! You can't even *read* the thing without solving it. Yeah. It was that. Turns out hookah *does* do something -- it turns off your brain's oxygen supply. And you don't notice it until you get up to go to the bathroom.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "And then the building doesn't come..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And then the building doesn't come down. And it still hasn't. That was 52 days ago. BUT THAT IS NOT THE POINT. The point is -- it *will* come down.

fields.Title: You: "Am I *absolutely* sure?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Am I *absolutely* sure?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yes. As you've said here: insuffera..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. As you've said here: insufferable rock-and-roll assholes. Young people are the worst. So anyway -- you got a complaint about the damn sofa. Or couch. Or whatever it was.

fields.Title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "It's me. I'm keeping his hand from..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's me. I'm keeping his hand from moving. We're not doing that anymore. We're not reading those words. People have died. He needs to work, not ache his heart for something that will never return.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "An aluminium block runs the width o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An aluminium block runs the width of the board, biting down on the paperwork. Its crocodile teeth are the only thing keeping the papers together. On it, the perforated watermark counting the achievements of the person you used to be.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "With your hands? U4-sized pages han..."
fields.Dialogue Text: With your hands? U4-sized pages hang from the clip screwed to the top of the board.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "This means you can read the waterma..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This means you can read the watermarks, if you just turn the lights on.

fields.Title: You: "I know, I know. Sylvie already told..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I know, I know. Sylvie already told me I dunked it in the toilet.

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "... so you wanted to get in on the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: ... so you wanted to get in on the trash-toilet stink collab? Find out what happens when those two get *funky* together? Okay, pal.

fields.Title: You: "Are you angry with me, nose?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Are you angry with me, nose?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "Yeah, turns out your nose doesn't l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, turns out your nose doesn't like self-indulgent literal-shit huffing. *Quelle fuckin' surprise*. Come on, no more -- the ledger is going back down, away from your nose now.

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "You know -- like the bits they put..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know -- like the bits they put into public piss bowls; probably called *Fermi-Discrete* or *Axel* or something. At some point in its journey the ledger has seen the inside of a public toilet.

fields.Title: You: "Alright then. Seems like a good ide..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Alright then. Seems like a good idea.  (Accept.)

fields.Title: You: "Enough of the clip. (Back.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: Enough of the clip. (Back.)

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Any capable light with the right w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Any capable light with the right wavelength will do."

fields.Title: You: ""Before, you mentioned the headligh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Before, you mentioned the headlights of your vehicle?"
fields.Alternate1: "You mentioned the headlights of your Kineema?"

fields.Title: You: "What is this?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What is this?

fields.Title: Logic: "Obviously, yes. The papers still sa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Obviously, yes. The papers still sag from the clipboard in your hand. It's a defiant sight. You're a hero.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The tasks you've completed flow out..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The tasks you've completed flow out of the pen in a brash freehand similar to the rest of the letters. The wording comes easily, it's almost robotically simple; a language developed for mental rigour and simplicity:
fields.Alternate1: The tasks you've completed flow out of the Kind Green Ape pen in a brash freehand similar to the rest of the letters. The wording comes easily, it's almost robotically simple; a language developed for mental rigour and simplicity:
fields.Alternate2: The tasks you've completed flow out of the Blue Oblong pen in a brash freehand uncannily similar to the rest of the letters. The wording comes easily, it's almost robotically simple; a language developed for mental rigour and simplicity:

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Like a fan of gills the chequered p..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Like a fan of gills the chequered papers dry in your hand. The handwriting is extremely dense, if mostly illegible.

fields.Title: You: ""I burned out all right.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I burned out all right."

fields.Title: You: "Good. How long does it take to read..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Good. How long does it take to read one of these *Raphal-stamped* cases? (Persist.)

fields.Title: Logic: "That's comforting to hear. Now, det..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's comforting to hear. Now, detective. It takes half an hour to piece one of these together -- if you still want to. Here are your options.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Threatening, fines, dragging them t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Threatening, fines, dragging them to the station, locking them up in the hell holes they live in, locking them up in the station, hypnotherapy -- even trying to get a local gang of *zemlyakis* to take them out (the zemlyakis gave them ethanol so Burke and Leslie would expose and rampage even harder) -- you tried it all. And still the complaints wouldn't stop. As they hadn't stopped for *ten years*.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's plain to see from the files th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's plain to see from the files that you, Satellite-Officer JV, and special consultant TH had more important cases to attend to. You uncover cross-reference to several ongoing investigations, each brought to a standstill every time you drive down Main Street. Because there they are! On the corner of Perdition, and what is Leslie doing?

fields.Title: Empathy: "It's unjust, that's why. You can't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's unjust, that's why. You can't even *get* to that thing anymore!

fields.Title: You: "Slide the hidden drawer open."
fields.Dialogue Text: Slide the hidden drawer open.

fields.Title: You: "Smell it first."
fields.Dialogue Text: Smell it first.

fields.Title: You: "What was that?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What was that?

fields.Title: Shivers: "Far away and outside... the reeds h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Far away and outside... the reeds hiss with desperation. Step out.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you," the lieutenant nods. "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Thank you," the lieutenant nods. "I think so too. Good and *normal*."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay then." He returns to his note..."]
Damaged Ledger: "It's going to take an effort to pie..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's going to take an effort to piece these case files together, but it can be done -- later, once you're done inspecting them up close.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
Damaged Ledger: "Yes, cops do that. *While* you're t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, cops do that. *While* you're taking a piss, you see a big crack in the wall. In the outer wall of the building. You can *feel* the cold air blow in. You take the elevator down, look up -- a big crack runs on the outer wall of the whole building.

fields.Title: You: "The tilt is beyond the point of max..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The tilt is beyond the point of maximum deviation from the gravity bearing perpendicular. This means that the building is falling -- and will fall no matter what.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The load bearing perpendicular. The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The load bearing perpendicular. The maximum deviation. All of it... Some people believe you. Most don't. Some you have to *forcibly* remove. Some even pull guns on you. It takes 20 hours to evacuate the whole building. 200 people stand outside in the cold. Children cry.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Yes. As you've said here: total ass..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes. As you've said here: total assholes. Young people are the worst.  So anyway -- you got a complaint about the damn sofa. Or couch. Or whatever it was.

fields.Title: You: "Did I ever catch those guys?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Did I ever catch those guys?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "No. You didn't have time for that,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. You didn't have time for that, these notes show that you have what is called *a real god damn job*. You don't have time to be chasing down the couch-assholes. You have a real job to do. What next?

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "The blue heart. Don't look into it."
fields.Dialogue Text: The blue heart. Don't look into it.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Hmm... it's as if there is an autom..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hmm... it's as if there is an automatic *self-defence* structure in your hand, keeping you from mind-fucking yourself with letters from past lovers.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Yes-yes, you know what that normal..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes-yes, you know what that normal name is -- but it's so plain... *anything* else, please.

fields.Title: Logic: "Dammit, take it anyway. Since you s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dammit, take it anyway. Since you so obviously *want* to be a detective Costeau.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Toxicology showed the entry wound w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Toxicology showed the entry wound was laced with an incredibly potent psychoactive substance called HUV4-Nil. No street name.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You feel the ledger slip from your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You feel the ledger slip from your hand.

fields.Title: You: "[Put the ledger away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Put the ledger away.]

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "*Which*? You're not sure you've sme..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Which*? You're not sure you've smelled this one yet, or worse... you have the nagging feeling you might have missed it.

fields.Title: You: "Hold on, what do you mean a metapho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hold on, what do you mean a metaphor for *me*?

fields.Title: You: ""How can I read it?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "How can I read it?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's the ledger you found in the tr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's the ledger you found in the trash: a cabbage of papers hanging from the board, barely held together by the clip -- and made complete by the faint smell of urinal cleaner.
fields.Alternate1: It's the ledger you found in the trash: a cabbage of papers hanging from the board, with the permeables' drawer inside. It's barely held together by a clip -- then made complete by the faint smell of urinal cleaner.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at his blue no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant looks at his blue notebook. *Two* fat, shiny pens hang from the binder, like large calibre bullets on an ammo belt.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "It's downright *incriminating*. He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's downright *incriminating*. He has little choice but to give you one, although he really does not want to.

fields.Title: You: ""I'm sure I made plenty of mistakes.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm sure I made plenty of mistakes."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...but -- do you also use the *tit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "...but -- do you also use the *titular*?"

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "No, you don't. You're a human measu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No, you don't. You're a human measuring instrument, almost entirely intellectual.

fields.Title: Perception (Hearing): "And something small inside? Light?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And something small inside? Light?  Made of paper or cardboard? Or dried flowers perhaps?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "It's made of dark blue plastic hard..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's made of dark blue plastic hard enough to beat someone to submission with. The edges are rounded, however. The U4-sized board feels thick and heavy in your hand. Light shimmers on its wet surface. On the back you see the embossed letters: RCM.

fields.Title: You: "Can I read the case files now?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Can I read the case files now?

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The crew agrees to clean up after t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The crew agrees to clean up after themselves. However, your partner -- JV -- is against the removal, citing public support for conservation. This leads to a debate in Precinct 41, which then spreads to the streets of Jamrock. Ending in a rare plebiscite -- organized by you and the rest of Row III.

fields.Title: Jump to: [back to main cases hub]
You: "Wait, do I ever find out who came u..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait, do I ever find out who came up with it?

fields.Title: You: "Blink."
fields.Dialogue Text: Blink.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're not going to *get* it. The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They're not going to *get* it. They're going to think: an idiot and a cock finger were on this case. So -- do you have something less *funny*?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The Ledger of (Oblivion Induced) Me..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The Ledger of (Oblivion Induced) Mental Health is just as shabby as the Damaged Ledger was: a bunch of sodden papers sags from the clipboard in your hand.

fields.Title: You: "With this beauty -- *COMMIT TO PAPE..."
fields.Dialogue Text: With this beauty -- *COMMIT TO PAPER*.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Mills didn't get off the pot -- not..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Mills didn't get off the pot -- not yet. He kept at it for a couple of weeks more, racking his brains, running with every theory, as outlandish as they seemed -- still couldn't solve the MURDER AT THE HOOKAH PARLOUR. Tough case, he said. Toughest he's ever had.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "You get a complaint -- no one's the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You get a complaint -- no one's there to take it. So you do call duty. The beating is taking place on the eighth floor. You take the elevator up. The building's creaking around you. Cold as hell. It's a run down old place. Concrete panels, rats everywhere.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "Oh god..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh god...

fields.Title: Half Light: "This stinking tissue will show ever..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This stinking tissue will show everyone what a bum you are. How little you give a shit. This toilet paper will PUNISH the world.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Did someone ask what you believe in..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Did someone ask what you believe in, man with the smelly toilet ledger? What do you want to tackle next? Or are we done?

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Thank you, waterlogged ledger, for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Thank you, waterlogged ledger, for spelling it out for us.

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know."

fields.Title: You: "Not interested, Logic. I don't take..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not interested, Logic. I don't take orders from anyone. (Decline.)

fields.Title: Logic: "It'd be nifty if you found somethin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It'd be nifty if you found something that way, wouldn't it? The papers still sagging from the clipboard in your hand -- not so nifty.

fields.Title: You: ""You know you have to give one to m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You know you have to give one to me, right? That *is* how human society works, I believe."

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "A satisfying slash sounds across th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A satisfying slash sounds across the paper. *You're done* it seems to say. And *you!* -- and *you!*

fields.Title: You: "What is in there -- what are they a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What is in there -- what are they about?

fields.Title: You: "There was mention of a... *naming c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There was mention of a... *naming convention* here?

fields.Title: Logic: "It's the middle of March -- you hav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's the middle of March -- you have attempted two cases a week on average.

fields.Title: You: ""Is two cases a week a good case lo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Is two cases a week a good case load, lieutenant?"

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "A dozen pages of thin copy paper, b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A dozen pages of thin copy paper, bright red in colour. You see the parameters of a deceased human form, waiting to be filled in: age, sex, condition of internal organs...

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "The forms feel moist, like the rest..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The forms feel moist, like the rest. Wavy to touch.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Your hand cramps up merely looking..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your hand cramps up merely looking at the scribbles, drawn -- as by some magnet -- to the red chequered margins. Fast, but always *straight*...

fields.Title: You: "Who is this person?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Who is this person?

fields.Title: Drama: "He understands you're *concealing*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He understands you're *concealing* something, sire.

fields.Title: You: ""Okay. Yes. It appears I do.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay. Yes. It appears I do."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a holdover from the early day..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's a holdover from the early days of the RCM -- right after the Revolution, when the organization had little idea how to do things. It persists in an *unofficial* capacity. Officers use these titles to refer to their work among themselves."

fields.Title: You: "I think I got it."
fields.Dialogue Text: I think I got it.

fields.Title: Logic: "Fine. It takes about half an hour f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fine. It takes about half an hour for you to piece one together, Mr... Raphal. Which one do you want?

fields.Title: You: "THE NEXT WORLD MURAL"
fields.Dialogue Text: THE NEXT WORLD MURAL

fields.Title: You: "THE SQUARE BULLET HOLE MURDERS"
fields.Dialogue Text: THE SQUARE BULLET HOLE MURDERS

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: "Did anyone ask what you believe in,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Did anyone ask what you believe in, man with the smelly toilet ledger? What do you want to tackle next? Or are we done?

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "A young woman in her twenties. Ther..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A young woman in her twenties. There is care, effort, and a *smile*, you think -- although that is not something you can read from someone's handwriting.

fields.Title: Damaged Ledger: ""Harry," it begins -- you're alread..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Harry," it begins -- you're already reading. "I wanted to write you a letter, so you can read it when you wake up. Maybe it will make you happy."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "It says: everyone look at me and my..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It says: everyone look at me and my *kitchen tissue* covered cop ledger! I don't *care*. My ledger is droopy and  smells like a urinal. Not a new addition, though. So keep that *styling case* open, my friend...
